Description: Rim sherd of Chian, probably black-figured, Komast pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline; top of rim glazed; exterior: dot and billet band at rim above part of large maeander square.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the pattern, see Pfisterer-Haas, S. 'Importkeramik in Milet', Archäologischer Anzeiger, 1999, fig. 9a-c, 263-271. Large metopal patterns are usually seen on Wild Goat Style vases, but these vases lack the interior decoration. Similar patterns are found on Black Figure komast chalices and quite often the rim pattern, such as this one, is rendered in a sloppy manner.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1241) (phase 2)
